metadata.title: CVE-2021-45868 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel before 5.15.3, fs/quota/quota_tree.c does not validatethe block number in the quota tree (on disk). This can, for example, leadto a kernel/locking/rwsem.c use-after-free if there is a corrupted quotafile.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-45868` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-1003-fips - 4.4.0-1098.105
linux-image-extra-4.4.0-1003-fips - 4.4.0-1098.105
linux-image-hmac-4.4.0-1003-fips - 4.4.0-1098.105
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-hwe: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
